subject: Music
title: Music and Babies
description: A micro-lesson that makes Music and Babies usable.

hook.text: Babies hear and respond to music before they're born â€” starting in the third trimester.

buildup.text: Newborns prefer music they heard in the womb over unfamiliar songs.

discovery.text: Lullabies lower infant cortisol and heart rate more than spoken words.

twist.text: Premature babies exposed to music in the NICU gain weight faster and leave sooner.

climax.text: Musical interaction helps infants develop bonding, trust, and emotional regulation.

punchline.text: The first language every baby understands is rhythm.

quiz.question: When do babies first respond to music?
options: In the third trimester, before birth
